seeker_post: HI (coach name). Sorry for not answering sooner. Seems to time files (1.1) and I get nothing done (1.2) and every day seems to have less and less energy to do anything. Its been 3 days raining and I have had very little sleep because of my daughter bloods are very unsuitable at night time. Can't walk anymore that much, seems its pulling my belly muscles and it's really hurts (dr said its attached to the front wall) a quess that's why the pain and I feel already so big (emojis). I'm trying to eat lots of fruits. Not being healthy as I wish cos 5 days a week I'm to one who is cooking and looking after the house (husband does 12h shifts 5-6days a week). I'm just wrecked and if I feel so I have a cookie or chocolate or 2-4... hopefully wheater improves and so my energy levels and being a bit more healthier then atm. And no I didn't do the snacks. I cook every day 3 meals for fam of 5 and atm I do not have that energy to do extra at any level. Sorry. Thank you for your messages and talk to you soon (participant name)
response_post: Thank you for sharing your current challenges. It's important to prioritize self-care and healthy eating habits, especially during pregnancy. Consider discussing your concerns with your healthcare provider for personalized advice. Remember to take care of yourself amidst your responsibilities. Keep in touch.

seeker_post: The next two weeks are extremely busy in work with the last two teaching weeks of term. It should hopefully be less hectic once it gets to corrections. Life is very busy and stressful at the moment, so I am only focusing on making sure I get the supplements every day and trying not to eat too much chocolate for the next two weeks. I've been trying to add some fruit, but I'm still eating loads of veggies, so I'm not overly stressing about that one. I know exercise helps with all this, but I don't have the time or headspace to fit it in at the moment, especially not something new. I will look at the stretches and set a new goal once I have survived this fortnight!
response_post: It's great that you are prioritizing your health by focusing on taking your supplements and incorporating fruits and vegetables into your diet. Remember to also prioritize self-care during busy times. Setting aside even a short amount of time for exercise or stretching can help manage stress levels. Consider scheduling in some time for physical activity to support your overall well-being.

seeker_post: Hi (coach name), Thanks for your videos, only seeing the last 2 now. Yes all is fine with the goals. However you are right, logging them and engaging in app is not top priority at the moment. I am happy with the goals I've set, breakfast, water and walking is being achieved at my pace. I am motivated to do as much as I can regarding healthy choices but also listening to my body when I need rest and a cup of tea. Nausea and sickness has lessened in the last 2 weeks so that has enabled me to eat more consciously and get back to some healthy breakfasts (like yoghurt, fruit and seeds etc). Walking in the evening is still sporadic but I am enjoying it and have engaged in a 100k in 30 days for charity with work. Again I am doing this when I feel I can and at my own pace. I am happy with my diet and behaviour right now and cravings are not an issue actually. I find my blood sugar to be stable too. Unfortunately I cannot promise more engagement with App, I will log when I think of it. Hope thats okay (emojis) thanks again, (participant name)
response_post: Thank you for your update, (participant name). It's great to hear that you are making progress with your goals at your own pace and feeling motivated to make healthy choices. Keep listening to your body and taking rest when needed. Remember to log your progress in the app whenever you can. Keep up the good work!

seeker_post: Hi (coach name). I'm doing ok so far, did great step account on last month but just after I hit my 20week/5mnt mark. I feel extremely tired and struggling to get 10 thousand step per day and partly I feel worn out and a bit if pain cos womb is attached on the front of the belly wall and I have constant 'pulling/stretching' pain. Less bread of course is still my coal l close list... or now might I need to munch less cookies. Its raining way too much for my liking and not having no energy lately will I say effect my treats snacking and mood lifting with food. I'll keep my goals atm the same just not to push my self more for something I can't accomplish and not having then self let down moments (participant name)
response_post: It's important to listen to your body and prioritize your health. Consider adjusting your step goal to a more manageable level given your current physical condition. Focus on nourishing foods to support your energy levels and mood. Remember to consult with your healthcare provider for any concerns regarding pain or fatigue. Stay committed to your goals while being mindful of your well-being.

seeker_post: Hi (coach name), I did a recording but I am not too sure where it saved so I stick with writing a little paragraph. Last week was a great week for exercise. I reached my 7 hrs a week exercise by doing my hour walk Monday to Friday and I started my exercise bike Friday and do that for 20 mins in the morning. Last Thursday I became really fizzy whilst on my walk and sweating. A weird sensation that came over me for about 10 mins. Perhaps my stomach was empty or was just over tired. My diet has not been great, although I've been drinking my water, food intake and treats have been a weakness, especially over the bank holiday weekend being out for picnics and a birthday party. The tips on physical activity is good. I actually do a good bit of gardening and cleaning so I should incorporate that into my exercise. I literally do not stop at home from 6.30 am intill 7pm. Kids are quite demanding (emoji)
response_post: It's great to hear about your commitment to exercise last week, reaching your goal of 7 hours per week. It's important to be mindful of your diet and hydration to support your physical activity. Incorporating gardening and cleaning into your exercise routine is a good idea. Keep up the good work!

seeker_post: Hello (coach name) good morning. My week was great, tnks God (emojis) the only problem was that I got so angry with my husband during the week. response_post: It is common for emotions to fluctuate during pregnancy due to hormonal changes. Keeping a food journal can help you track your eating habits and identify any patterns. Remember to consult with your healthcare provider about your vaccine and test results. Good luck with your efforts!

response_post: Thank you for the update, (participant name). It's great to hear that you're feeling better now. Remember, you can still track your progress manually if you're not comfortable using apps. Keep up the good work with your daily goals. If you have any questions or need assistance, feel free to reach out.

seeker_post: Hi (coach name) Thank you! Yes baby boy born Wednesday, a lovely calm elective section and only 31 hours in hospital after. I am useless, sorry missed all of these messages and most from family and friends (emojis). Definitely did too much at once with a pretty non flexible deadline! Realised as well I never did a final weigh in before c section! Never managed to start up yoga or other exercise beyond daily life needs but as soon as I am fit and able I must start some activities again. Will book in for a video chat in January. Thank you for not giving up on me! Newborn life is just as I remember it but I seem to be more used to sleep deprivation so I will need to look at some of those mindfulness techniques you sent. Breastfeeding mega demanding and sore but I know will be best in the long run (just need to remember to put the vit d drops on before we start (emojis)). Whole house is very excited for Christmas, (name) is especially keen but I love it because it keeps me going. Hope you're well and looking forward to Christmas with the family (participant name) x
response_post: Congratulations on the birth of your baby boy! It's great to hear that the elective section went smoothly. Remember to prioritize self-care and gradually ease back into activities when you're ready. Looking forward to our video chat in January. Take care!

seeker_post: Hi (coach name), I’m doing ok thanks just really bad on keeping you updated on here. I’m really sorry. I was wondering going forwards if we could do quick 5-10 mins call update. Is this something you can do? I’m just very bad at assigning time to sit down and write as always get distracted and put it off to later. No worries if this is not possible. The PGP has actually calmed down which is great and have been able to go out for walks again and generally just move about a bit more. The midwife has referred me for some physio so waiting for an appointment to come through. I’m also told they might give me belt to wear which will help. I have noticed this week (probably because of the heat) that my fingers / hands & feet are quite swollen. My water intake has dropped so have put a reminder in my work calendar to alert me. Food wise, my portion size is still on the large size. Don’t know how to manage this. Hope to speak to you soon Thanks (participant name)
response_post: Thank you for the update. I appreciate your willingness to improve communication. A quick 5-10 minute call update going forward is not feasible. Please continue to provide updates through this platform. I'm glad to hear that your PGP has calmed down and that you're able to move more. Follow the midwife's advice regarding physio and the belt. Remember to stay hydrated and manage your portion sizes for better nutrition. Keep up the good work.

seeker_post: Hi (coach name), Thanks for your advice about proteins, I’ve added it to my goals. I hit my head and have a lovely black eye. Due to this my goals and everything have taken a backseat. I’ve been advised to sit down as much as possible with my feet up. I’m struggling with controlling my body temp so am constantly hot which is making things worse! I went back to work Thursday and managed ok. The baby is causing me to have my first cravings - wholegrain cheerios! I’ve just booked in my c section in 5 weeks! Any advice on how to prepare would be great. I’ve been signposted to Bluebell to support with my mental health although feeling ok at the moment. I am starting maternity leave in 2 weeks so will have a lot more time for me (for a few weeks lol!) Sorry for the long message! (participant name)
response_post: Thank you for sharing your update. It's important to prioritize your health and well-being during this time. Remember to follow your healthcare provider's advice and take care of yourself. As you prepare for your c-section, ensure you have all necessary arrangements in place and follow any guidance provided by your medical team. Enjoy your maternity leave and focus on resting and preparing for the arrival of your baby. If you have any specific concerns or questions, feel free to reach out. Wishing you a smooth recovery and a healthy delivery.

seeker_post: I had a rough day at work, and then my significant other texted me out of the blue, saying they need some space. I don't know what to do or how to feel about it.
response_post: It's important to communicate openly with your significant other to understand their needs and concerns. Take some time to reflect on your own feelings and consider discussing the situation with them in person to gain clarity on the situation.

seeker_post: My friend and I have been arguing a lot lately. We just can't seem to understand each other and it's causing a strain on our friendship.
response_post: It may be helpful to have a calm and open conversation with your friend to address the issues causing the arguments and work towards finding common ground. Communication and understanding each other's perspectives are key in resolving conflicts.

seeker_post: Hi. I've been feeling really down lately. I lost my job a few months ago, and despite all my efforts, I haven't been able to find a new one. I'm starting to feel hopeless.
response_post: I'm sorry to hear about your job loss. It's important to stay persistent in your job search and consider seeking support from career services or networking opportunities. Keep applying and stay proactive in your search.

seeker_post: Honestly, I've been feeling so alone lately. It's been really difficult for me and it's starting to impact my friendship with my best friend.
response_post: It's important to communicate your feelings with your best friend in a clear and direct manner. Consider discussing how you've been feeling and any changes you'd like to see in your friendship.

seeker_post: I've been feeling a bit discouraged lately. I've been trying to lose weight, but it's been really hard to stay motivated and see any progress.
response_post: It's common to face challenges when trying to lose weight. Consider setting specific, achievable goals and creating a structured plan to help you stay on track. Remember that progress may not always be immediately visible, but consistency is key.

seeker_post: I'm feeling really frustrated. My colleague keeps taking credit for my work and it's causing tension in the workplace.
response_post: It is important to address this issue directly with your colleague. Consider discussing the situation with your supervisor or HR department to find a resolution. Clearly communicate your concerns and provide evidence of your work to support your claims.

seeker_post: Honestly, I'm feeling really down. I just got laid off from my job in the tech industry and I'm feeling overwhelmed and unmotivated.
response_post: I'm sorry to hear about your job loss. It's important to take some time to process this change and then start focusing on finding new opportunities in the tech industry. Update your resume and start networking to explore new job options. Remember to stay proactive and determined in your job search.

seeker_post: I've been feeling really overwhelmed lately. I recently started a new job, and I'm having a hard time keeping up with the workload and meeting the expectations.
response_post: It's important to prioritize tasks and communicate with your supervisor about your workload. Consider seeking guidance or training to improve your efficiency.

seeker_post: It's been a few weeks since the breakup, but I still can't stop thinking about our memories and everything we shared. I feel so disconnected and alone without them.
response_post: It's normal to feel this way after a breakup. It may take time to adjust to the change and move on. Consider seeking support from friends, family, or a therapist to help you process your feelings and move forward.

seeker_post: I've been having issues with my roommate. We can't seem to agree on how to divide the household chores, and it's causing a lot of frustration and tension between us.
response_post: It's important to establish clear communication and set up a chore schedule that both you and your roommate can agree on. Consider having a discussion to address the issue and come up with a fair division of responsibilities.

seeker_post: I'm feeling really down lately. My best friend's mom passed away and she's having a tough time.
response_post: I'm sorry to hear about your friend's loss. It's important to offer support and be there for them during this difficult time. If you need further assistance or resources on how to help your friend cope, please let me know.

seeker_post: I'm okay, thank you. I actually wanted to talk to you about something. My best friend is going through a tough time after losing her mom. It's been really hard for her to cope with the grief.
response_post: I'm sorry to hear about your friend's loss. It's important to offer support and be there for her during this difficult time. Encourage her to seek professional help if needed and provide a listening ear whenever she needs to talk.

seeker_post: It's about my co-worker. Every time we have a team meeting, they always interrupt me and don't let me share my thoughts. It's really frustrating.
response_post: It's important to address this issue directly with your co-worker. Consider speaking to them privately to express your concerns and request that they allow you to share your thoughts during team meetings without interruption. If the behavior continues, you may need to involve your supervisor or HR department for further assistance.

seeker_post: My sibling just lost their pet. They've had that pet for so many years and they're heartbroken. I want to comfort them, but I'm not sure how to help.
response_post: Offering your sibling a listening ear and being there for them during this difficult time can provide comfort. You can also suggest practical ways to help, such as assisting with any necessary arrangements or tasks related to the pet's passing.

seeker_post: I'm okay, but I've been feeling quite lonely lately.
response_post: It's important to address feelings of loneliness. Consider reaching out to friends or family for support, or seeking professional help if needed.

seeker_post: Exactly, it's like we're speaking different languages sometimes. I just want my partner to be able to understand me and provide the emotional support I need.
response_post: It's important to communicate your needs clearly to your partner in order to establish mutual understanding and support in the relationship.

seeker_post: I've been feeling really upset and ignored by my best friend lately. We used to be so close, but now it feels like they don't care about our friendship anymore.
response_post: It's important to communicate your feelings with your friend and address the situation directly. Express your concerns and see if you can work together to improve your friendship.

seeker_post: I've been so stressed lately because I have a job interview coming up. I keep doubting myself and worrying that I won't do well.
response_post: It's normal to feel stressed before a job interview. Try to focus on preparing thoroughly and practicing your responses. Confidence in your abilities will help you perform well.

seeker_post: To be honest, work has been really tough lately. I'm feeling overwhelmed and starting to experience burnout.
response_post: It's important to prioritize self-care and seek support when feeling overwhelmed. Consider discussing your workload and stress levels with your supervisor to explore potential solutions. Remember to take breaks and practice stress management techniques to prevent burnout.

seeker_post: Lately, my partner and I have been constantly arguing and having misunderstandings, and it's really taking a toll on our relationship.

seeker_post: I have an important job interview coming up, and I can't shake off this anxiety. I don't know how to handle it.
response_post: It is common to feel anxious before a job interview. To manage your anxiety, try practicing relaxation techniques such as deep breathing or visualization. Additionally, prepare thoroughly for the interview by researching the company and practicing common interview questions. Good luck.

seeker_post: About a year ago, I survived a sexual assault and since then, I find it really hard to open up and trust people. I'm scared to get close to anyone now.
response_post: I recommend seeking support from a mental health professional to address the trauma you experienced and work through your trust issues. Therapy can help you develop coping strategies and gradually rebuild your ability to trust others.

seeker_post: It's my colleague at work. They keep stealing my ideas and taking credit for my work. It's really starting to get on my nerves.
response_post: You should address this issue directly with your colleague and discuss your concerns about the situation. It's important to communicate clearly and assertively to ensure that your work is properly recognized.

seeker_post: Honestly, I've been feeling really overwhelmed and stressed out. My boss keeps piling up tasks on me, and I can't seem to catch a break. I'm struggling to meet all the deadlines.

seeker_post: Yeah, it's been tough. I left all my friends behind and now I don't know how to meet new people.

seeker_post: Lately, I've been feeling really frustrated at work. I don't feel like my ideas and opinions are being heard or valued. It's starting to impact my confidence and job satisfaction.
response_post: I recommend scheduling a meeting with your supervisor to discuss your concerns and explore ways to ensure your ideas and opinions are considered. It's important to address these issues proactively to improve your work environment.

seeker_post: My best friend and I have been arguing a lot lately. We can't seem to agree on our future plans and it's causing a lot of tension between us.
response_post: It may be helpful to have a calm and open discussion with your friend to try to understand each other's perspectives and find a compromise. Communication is key in resolving conflicts.

seeker_post: I've been having so many arguments with my best friend lately. We were planning a trip together, but we can't seem to agree on the itinerary and it's causing a lot of tension between us.

seeker_post: I've been better. I recently lost my dog, and it's been really tough. She was my best friend for 12 years, and I miss her deeply.
response_post: I'm sorry to hear about the loss of your dog. If you need any assistance or information, feel free to ask.

seeker_post: Honestly, not great. I've been dealing with a lot of emotions ever since my long-term partner and I broke up. It's been really tough on me.

seeker_post: Work has been really stressful lately. I'm feeling overwhelmed with the amount of work I have to do. The workload suddenly increased, and I'm struggling to meet deadlines and manage my time effectively.

seeker_post: I have to consistently meet tight deadlines, work long hours, and deal with a lot of pressure from my boss. It's taking a toll on me both mentally and physically.

seeker_post: It's been really tough. I've tried to meet new people, but it feels like I can't connect with anyone or find people with similar interests.
response_post: I recommend trying different social settings or activities to increase your chances of meeting people with similar interests. Keep putting yourself out there and be open to new experiences.

seeker_post: I'm feeling really down lately. I recently moved to a new city and it's been hard to make friends. I feel really lonely and isolated.
response_post: It's common to feel lonely after moving to a new city. Consider joining local clubs or groups to meet new people with similar interests. Engaging in social activities can help alleviate feelings of isolation.

response_post: I'm sorry to hear about your loss. If you need any assistance or resources during this difficult time, please let me know.
